Hi gurus  am a noob invester here. any feedback on my syfe core growth portfolio. Started in 2021 and have been dca-ing monthly and this is the first time I see green after almost 3 years. First time posting here. Pls be nice. =)

Stay on course with your monthly DCA plan. My syfe equity100 (DCA weekly since 2021) has been positive since Nov 2023. It will be more green eventually as there are some China ETFs in the portfolio. China/Hang Seng markets are recovering well since early Feb 2024.

Hi  my HSBC bank has been restricted 3 times within 6 months after being reactivated without giving any valid reasons. It has been restricted by CDD team even I have updated my particulars at their branch. The recent restriction might hinder me to earn 1% cashback. Has anyone encountered this previously or lately? If yes  how did you resolve the matter to prevent the similar incident to happen again? Or should I just close the account?
What about the amount I gain  should I leave it or withdraw that amount? I mean what usually ppl do about it. Sorry noob question ha üòÖ
Hi all  anyone know how to track which UOB transactions give me the qualifying UNI$ for the Lady‚Äôs solitaire credit card? Seems like I‚Äôm short of UNI$
Does anyone know a good application that tracks your spending monthly with the least amount of manual efforts (keying in  categorizing  etc) that can also provide simple insights of cashflow  etc?

You have to ask yourself if your syfe core growth portfolio is going to be for your long term goals like for retirement  housing  monetary gains etc. A long term investor should never be emotional no matter how the market behaves i.e. up or down. Staying invested in the market is the best course of action. One should stay disciplined and stick to your DCA plan whether you see red or green. But having said that  it is your money  so the choice is yours to decide.

Just received SMS from UOBUOB Lady's Solitaire Card: With effect from 1 Apr'24  the maximum aggregated amount of Bonus UNI$ you can earn in a calendar month will be capped at 3 600 UNI$ (equiv. to S$2 000 spent). Please also be reminded that the accelerated earn rate of 15X UNI$ per S$5 spent on your preferred rewards category(ies) will end 31 Mar'24. After which  you will continue to earn 10X UNI$ per S$5 spend on your preferred rewards category(ies). Visit UOB Lady's Card website for details and stay tuned for more exciting benefits launching on 1 Apr'24.
